close_symbols: struct SHA1Context (full definition: members message_block, intermediate_hash, message_block_index and their types)
uint8_t or byte type used for message_block (typedef)
explanation: 1) struct SHA1Context (full definition): required to determine whether members accessed/assigned in the function are arrays or pointers and their types. The MISRA rule allows modification of the object pointed to by a pointer parameter but forbids changing the parameter (the pointer) itself; to decide whether context->message_block, context->intermediate_hash and context->message_block_index are legal modifications we must know their declarations (e.g. whether message_block is uint8_t[] or uint8_t* and the type of message_block_index). 2) SHA1CircularShift (declaration/definition): required to ensure this symbol is not a macro or inline definition that could modify the parameter variable 'context' (e.g. via unexpected macro expansions or side effects). Also to confirm it has no hidden parameter access that could affect the analysis. 3) uint32_t (typedef): integer type used throughout the function and in struct members — needed to resolve member types in the struct definition and ensure correct interpretation of assignments. 4) uint8_t or byte type used for message_block (typedef): the exact element type of message_block is used in the code (byte accesses and shifts); knowing the type determines whether the code writes through the pointer-to-member (permitted) or would require changing pointer values (disallowed).
